name: Aardonyx
description: Aardonyx is a genus of prosauropod dinosaur that lived in the Early Jurassic Period of South Africa. The type species is Aardonyx celestae. The generic name is derived from the Afrikaans word aarde, meaning 'earth', and the Greek word onyx, meaning 'claw' or 'hoof'. The specific name celestae honors Celeste Yates, who prepared the holotype specimen.

name: Abelisaurus
description: Abelisaurus is a genus of predatory abelisaurid theropod dinosaur during the Late Cretaceous Period of what is now South America. It was a bipedal carnivore that probably reached about 7.4 meters (24 ft 3 in) in length, although this is uncertain as it is known from only one partial skull.

name: Abrictosaurus
description: Abrictosaurus is a genus of heterodontosaurid dinosaur that lived during the Early Jurassic Period in what is now South Africa. The type species is Abrictosaurus consors. The generic name is derived from the Greek word abrictos, meaning 'delicate', and the Greek word sauros, meaning 'lizard'.
